modules.description: This module implements a monadic interface for handling asynchronous HTTP requests in the context of a Bitcoin client. It provides `return`, `fail`, `bind`, and `catch` operations to compose and sequence effectful computations that may fail or perform I/O. It works directly with the `Cohttp_lwt_unix.Client` to enable concise chaining of HTTP calls required for interacting with Bitcoin nodes or APIs.

This module implements a monadic interface for handling asynchronous HTTP requests in the context of a Bitcoin client. It provides `return`, `fail`, `bind`, and `catch` operations to compose and sequence effectful computations that may fail or perform I/O. It works directly with the `Cohttp_lwt_unix.Client` to enable concise chaining of HTTP calls required for interacting with Bitcoin nodes or APIs.

This module implements a monadic interface for composing asynchronous HTTP requests tailored to Bitcoin client interactions. It provides `return`, `bind`, `catch`, and `fail` operations to sequence I/O-bound computations that interface with Bitcoin nodes via `Cohttp_lwt_unix.Client`. Direct use cases include building and chaining HTTP calls to query blockchain data, submit transactions, or interact with remote Bitcoin APIs.
